In order to model y with a Pareto distribution, you will need to specify the parameters of the distribution, such as the shape parameter and the scale parameter. You can then use the built-in functions in MATLAB to generate random variables with this distribution.

To add a threshold for every y, you will need to modify the code to only generate y values that are above a certain threshold. For example, you can add a conditional statement that checks if the generated y value is above the threshold, and if not, generate a new y value until one above the threshold is obtained.

Here's an example of how to incorporate a threshold into the code:

% Generate random y values with a Pareto distribution
alpha = 2; % shape parameter
beta = 1; % scale parameter
threshold = 10; % threshold value

y = -1;
while y < threshold
y = beta \* random(makedist('Pareto', 'a', alpha));
end

% Use y in the rest of the code as needed

In this example, the while loop will continue to generate new y values until one above the threshold is obtained. You can adjust the shape parameter, scale parameter, and threshold to match your desired distribution and threshold values.
